intro: Aporosa villosula, commonly known as the hairy aporosa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Aporosa villosula is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
